item.title: Biography
item.description:
Photograph by Antony Sojka.

Bio

Alper Çuğun-Gscheidel M.Sc. is an engineer, designer and author working in software engineering.

Alper graduated with a Master of Sciences in Media and Knowledge Engineering from Delft University of Technology with a minor in Management of Technology.

From 2007-2010 he was co-founder and public face of crowd-funding startup TipiT. After that he founded the first Dutch data visualization agency Monster Swell and became an activist in the open data movement. During this period he was program director of Hack de Overheid’s successful “Apps for Amsterdam” event series. This culminated in the creation of the Open State Foundation, an open data institution for which Alper served on the board.

item.title: Speaking
item.description:
For speaking engagements you can get in touch with The Next Speaker.

I’m busy creating novel ways of organization and expression using procedurality in design and technology. To do this I write, design and build things in the most suitable medium to achieve goals and persuade people. The practice of this work yields ample examples and experiences to talk about.

We build interactive data-visualizations using real-time data and cartography on pre-existing and bespoke platforms for companies, government, artists and journalists. We conceive tools and practices for data gathering, analysis and literacy in the wide sense. We are proficient in statistics, machine learning and algorithms to create smart but humane systems.
